critique: This executive order primarily concerns the renaming and restructuring of a presidential council. It changes the name from "President's Council on Counter-Narcotics" to the "President's Drug Policy Council" and expands the council's membership to include additional cabinet secretaries and advisors. The order itself doesn't directly address ideological issues, immigration, executive power in a significant way, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The changes seem largely administrative.
